title: Task 34

question.text: What does Sarah imply about consistency in her routine?

answers.answer: She prefers to start her day at a different pace every day
answers.feedback: Consistency implies regularity, not varying pace, and on the right foot suggests a positive start.

answers.answer: She always has difficulties starting her day
answers.feedback: Starting on the right foot implies a positive start, which contradicts having difficulties.

answers.answer: Regular habits help her start the day positively
Her days usually start in an unplanned manner
answers.feedback: Consistency and starting on the right foot both imply planned, positive regularity, not an unplanned manner.

dialogue.text: It's my pleasure. It's the consistency that helps me start the day off on the right foot.

description:
The word consistency refers to the quality of always behaving or performing in a similar way, or of always happening in a similar way. It's often used to describe regular habits or behaviors. For example:

Her consistency in studying every day led to great results.

The phrase on the right foot is an idiom meaning to start something in a positive or successful way. For example:

Starting the day with a healthy breakfast sets you on the right foot.
